value.title: DAX Fridays #156:  How unsensitive of DAX!!!
value.excerpt: Did you know that DAX and PowerPivot are case insensitive? If that is causing you problems, watch this video to learn how to fix it!  Here is the link to chris post: https://blog.crossjoin.co.uk/2019/10/06/power-bi-and-case-sensitivity/  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: DAX Fridays! #163: Best practices when using error functions in DAX
value.excerpt: Sometimes you have to use iferror or iserror functions when writing DAX measures, but that is often not a good practice. In today's video I will tell you why and what you can do to avoid them as much as possible.  Get Northwind Dataset: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k3NMIlLffrU  Link to DAX Fridays

value.title: DAX Fridays! #166: Compare spread after the first 100 cases | Recreating the Financial Times Graph
value.excerpt: In todays video I will show you how to recreate the financial times graph in power bi where they compare the spread of confirmed cases after the countries hit their first 100 cases.  We will do the calculation using DAX and will plot the graph in Power BI.  Link to FT article: https://www.ft.com/content/a26fbf7e-48f8-11ea-aeb3-955839e06441

value.title: DAX Fridays! #168: COALESCE function a.k.a koala function ;)

I also answer Question 2 of the Microsoft Power BI exam  and ask question 3. Happy Friday!  Link to sqlserver tutorial: https://www.sqlservertutorial.net/sql-server-basics/sql-server-coalesce/

value.title: DAX FRIDAYS! #178 : My age calculations in DAX and Power Query are wrong!! How do I do it?
value.excerpt: Calculating age is harder that you think, both in power query and dax.  In today's video, I am going to show you two ways to do it with DAX  and power query that get the closest to the actual age.  Do you know any other method to calculate age? Share it in the comments!
